title: Adios Script released
content:
We are proud to announce the release of **[Adios Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/123)**

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-1_3748.jpg)

As part of the **[PDF specimen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549/http:/tinyurl.com/qfr6dl)**, the mexican photographer Brenda Dan was invited to collaborate with some beautiful image.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-2_6062.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-9_6227.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-10_4508.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-11_5182.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adios-Script-pdf-14_3488.jpg)

Romantic, decorative Adios Script is one of Alejandro Paul’s most elaborate and technically refined faces to date. Inspired by designs in “how-to” commercial lettering guides of the 1940s, it has been refined and brought into the 21st century through a huge variety of ornate swash letterforms. The lowercase “h” alone offers 43 variants. Hundreds of ornamental ascenders and descenders allow a beautiful interplay of strokes and combinations, while avoiding overlaps or conflicts. Adios Script features a mind-boggling 1,470 characters in total, in OpenType format.

Veer just released a very nice [slideshow](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015031549/http:/www.veer.com/ideas/galleries/adios/)
author: Ale Paul
